Example

Example.Rmd

Overview

This vignette demonstrates how to use the {samplezoo} package to generate datasets of varying sizes (small, medium, and large) with random variables from multiple probability distributions.

Each dataset contains:

  • Random variables from distributions such as Normal, Binomial, Poisson, and others.

  • Adjustable sample sizes to meet needs.

library(samplezoo)

Generate a small dataset (i.e., 100 rows) 

data_small <- samplezoo("small")
head(data_small)
#>       norm    norm2     norm3 binom neg pois        exp       unif      beta
#> 1 28.99935 56.12786 31.412398     0   0    4  1.9930731 0.85065681 0.4924950
#> 2 53.82976 52.14567 67.209227     0   3    2  0.5548857 0.02154078 0.1720294
#> 3 13.44105 49.43263 38.582851     0   1    2  6.6549962 0.25282988 0.1254429
#> 4 49.91643 52.04459 34.556926     0   2    1  4.9418966 0.65671150 0.2700426
#> 5 59.32329 42.43725 -8.933601     1   0    1 21.7477214 0.78914941 0.4219464
#> 6 67.22617 53.09462 41.309733     1   0    2  3.2594742 0.70884565 0.3508093
#>       gamma      chisq
#> 1 9.2714439 0.68455500
#> 2 0.8928559 1.60444217
#> 3 2.1155766 4.49945206
#> 4 1.6750690 4.84609857
#> 5 1.3651080 0.02755675
#> 6 5.3570542 0.28503365

Generate a medium sized dataset (i.e., 1,000 rows) 

data_medium <- samplezoo("medium")
head(data_medium)
#>       norm    norm2     norm3 binom neg pois       exp       unif       beta
#> 1 64.40796 83.90644 -2.486232     0   1    2 27.404516 0.96783420 0.52612092
#> 2 39.88630 53.03421 10.566485     0   0    2 15.251583 0.35407321 0.05446017
#> 3 66.87017 68.57870 31.805501     0   0    0  1.824185 0.01441065 0.57933933
#> 4 87.09406 73.52693 35.384813     0   1    3  6.408208 0.47968010 0.25278284
#> 5 76.10305 62.45759 42.686465     0   0    6  5.539373 0.85640555 0.19658888
#> 6 27.03865 68.06325 29.859468     0   0    1  2.604218 0.46877092 0.21628824
#>      gamma     chisq
#> 1 3.635454 5.0779950
#> 2 1.378563 0.1601322
#> 3 1.815207 0.8783469
#> 4 3.836731 7.7229946
#> 5 6.257226 0.6192293
#> 6 2.705477 0.2254585

Generate a large sized dataset (i.e., 10,000 rows) 

data_large <- samplezoo("large")
head(data_large)
#>       norm    norm2      norm3 binom neg pois       exp      unif       beta
#> 1 53.55283 55.00574 38.0662478     0   0    3  8.999320 0.2471210 0.13519224
#> 2 38.09189 50.74107 65.0810591     0   1    5  1.893067 0.6066764 0.48166840
#> 3 55.90028 68.38169 30.1993252     0   0    3 11.011677 0.8135610 0.14155290
#> 4 61.66090 59.52062  0.9267081     0   0    4 22.846478 0.5045493 0.42657889
#> 5 39.58526 51.89169 71.1111903     0   0    0 21.629143 0.8000134 0.26931346
#> 6 68.05143 76.73785 56.0540746     0   2    2 30.626678 0.1445336 0.04763836
#>       gamma     chisq
#> 1  8.374874 2.0378512
#> 2  1.903083 2.4499349
#> 3 17.506459 0.7130187
#> 4  3.548203 0.2482450
#> 5  9.258196 1.4633951
#> 6  7.939315 1.6870241

Ensuring Reproducibility with set.seed()

To ensure reproducibility, use set.seed() before generating a dataset. This guarantees the same random values are produced each time the code is run.

set.seed(123)
data_large <- samplezoo("large")
head(data_large)
#>       norm    norm2     norm3 binom neg pois       exp      unif       beta
#> 1 41.59287 83.70725 23.274065     0   1    6  6.628373 0.5468223 0.08294255
#> 2 46.54734 58.33188 35.588540     0   0    5 21.305366 0.3900809 0.63544684
#> 3 73.38062 69.26961 -2.070295     0   2    4  0.189645 0.7262119 0.11520674
#> 4 51.05763 54.31848  6.643849     0   2    2  8.479098 0.5101462 0.38184206
#> 5 51.93932 62.25090 18.040743     0   0    2 11.885521 0.2964126 0.17196046
#> 6 75.72597 71.31986  6.687576     0   1    4  6.363993 0.1442317 0.35908460
#>       gamma     chisq
#> 1 6.9893762 1.4573882
#> 2 5.4087626 0.3062096
#> 3 1.2587867 0.6896385
#> 4 0.9871787 3.9647042
#> 5 2.4021943 1.7179673
#> 6 4.2109032 6.2201232
set.seed(123)
data_large <- samplezoo("large")
head(data_large)
#>       norm    norm2     norm3 binom neg pois       exp      unif       beta
#> 1 41.59287 83.70725 23.274065     0   1    6  6.628373 0.5468223 0.08294255
#> 2 46.54734 58.33188 35.588540     0   0    5 21.305366 0.3900809 0.63544684
#> 3 73.38062 69.26961 -2.070295     0   2    4  0.189645 0.7262119 0.11520674
#> 4 51.05763 54.31848  6.643849     0   2    2  8.479098 0.5101462 0.38184206
#> 5 51.93932 62.25090 18.040743     0   0    2 11.885521 0.2964126 0.17196046
#> 6 75.72597 71.31986  6.687576     0   1    4  6.363993 0.1442317 0.35908460
#>       gamma     chisq
#> 1 6.9893762 1.4573882
